document.docAuthor: Xue, Xiao-Feng, Song, Zi-Wei & Hong, Xiao-Yue
document.docTitle: Tetra zhouzhis Xue, Song & Hong, 2007, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Six new species of Te t r a Keifer (Acari: Eriophyidae: Phyllocoptinae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new species of Te t r a Keifer (Acari: Eriophyidae: Phyllocoptinae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. FEMALE: (n = 18 ) Body fusiform, 178 ( 162–191 ), 61 ( 56–62 ) wide, 63 ( 62–64 ) thick; light yellow. Gnathosoma 26 ( 25–27 ), projecting obliquely down, pedipalp coxal setae ( ep ) 2 ( 2–3 ), dorsal pedipalp genual setae ( d ) 6 ( 6–7 ), chelicerae 25 ( 25–26 ), oral stylets 23 ( 23–24 ). Prodorsal shield 48 ( 46–50 ), 50 ( 49– 52 ) wide; semicircular; frontal lobe broad; median line present 1 / 3 at base, median and admedian lines connected at basal 1 / 3 , admedian and submedian lines connected, forming 2 large cells, admedian and submedian lines sinuous. Dorsal tubercles on rear margin, 35 ( 35–36 ) apart, scapular setae ( sc ) 7 ( 7–8 ) projecting posteriorly. Coxal area with short lines and granules; anterolateral setae on coxisternum І (
1 b
) 11 ( 10–13 ), proximal setae on coxisternum І (
1 a
) 18 ( 16–19 ), proximal setae on coxisternum І (
2 a
) 35 ( 32–36 ). Prosternal apodeme present. Legs with usual series of setae. Legs
І 32
( 30–34 ), femur 9 ( 8–9 ), basiventral femoral setae ( bv ) 8 ( 7–8 ); genu 5 ( 5–6 ), antaxial genual setae ( l'' ) 17 ( 17–18 ); tibia 8 ( 8–9 ), paraxial tibial setae ( l' ) 5 ( 5–6 ), setae located 1 / 3 from dorsal base; tarsus 6 ( 5–6 ); empodium simple, 4 -rayed, tarsal solenidion knobbed. Legs
І 27
( 25–29 ), femur 7 ( 7–8 ), basiventral femoral setae ( bv ) 8 ( 7–9 ); genu 4 ( 4–5 ), antaxial genual setae ( l'' ) 7 ( 6–7 ); tibia 5 ( 5–6 ); tarsus 5 ( 4–5 ); empodium simple, 4 -rayed, tarsal solenidion knobbed. Opisthosoma : dorsal opisthosoma with 34 ( 33–36 ) annuli, with elliptical microtubercles, ventrally with 60 ( 58–62 ) annuli, with round microtubercles. Setae
c 2
19 ( 18–20 ) on ventral annulus 12 ( 12–13 ); setae d 55 ( 49–58 ) on ventral annulus 24 ( 23–25 ), 23 ( 22–25 ) apart; setae e 18 ( 17–20 ) on ventral annulus 40 ( 38–42 ), 13 ( 12–13 ) apart; setae f 24 ( 22–26 ) on 6 th ventral annulus from rear, 12 ( 11–12 ) apart. Setae
h 1
3 ( 2–3 ), setae
h 2
53 ( 51–56 ). Female genitalia 11 ( 11–12 ), 20 ( 20–21 ) wide, coverflap with 12 longitudinal ridges, proximal setae on coxisternum ІІ (
3 a
) 26 ( 23–28 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6.
Tetra zhouzhis
sp. nov. A, dorsal view of female; B, coxae and female genitalia; C, legs І and І; D, empodium; E, male genitalia; F, lateral view of anterior region; G, lateral microtubercles; H, lateral view of the caudal opisthosoma.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Legs
І 25
( 24–26 ), femur 6 ( 6–7 ), basiventral femoral setae ( bv ) 7 ( 7–8 ); genu 4 ( 4–5 ), antaxial genual setae ( l'' ) 5 ( 5–6 ); tibia 4 ( 4–5 ); tarsus 4 ( 4–5 ); empodium simple, 4 -rayed, tarsal solenidion knobbed. Opisthosoma : dorsal opisthosoma with 30 ( 28–31 ) annuli, with elliptical microtubercles, ventrally with 63 ( 58–64 ) annuli, with round microtubercles. Setae
c 2
18 ( 18–20 ) on ventral annulus 12 ( 12–13 ); setae d 35 ( 33–36 ) on ventral annulus 20 ( 19–20 ); setae e 13 ( 11–13 ) on ventral annulus 38 ( 38–39 ), setae f 21 ( 20–21 ) on 6 th ventral annulus from rear. Setae
h 1
3 ( 2–3 ). Male genitalia 5 ( 5–6 ), 18 ( 17–19 ) wide, proximal setae on coxisternum ІІ (
3 a
) 20 ( 19–23 ).

Types . Holotype
, female, China : Shaanxi Province, Zhouzhi County, Hei River, 33.88°N , 108.09°E .
August 13, 2005
, from
Pistacia chinensis Bunge
( Anacardiaceae ), coll. Xue, Xiao-Feng and Song, Zi-Wei.
Paratypes
,
7 females
and
5 males
, with the same data as holotype ;
10 females
, China : Heilongjiang Province, Jingbo Lake, 43.52°N , 128.54°E .
July 28, 2006
, from
Pistacia chinensis Bunge
( Anacardiaceae ), coll. Xue, Xiao-Feng and Song, Zi-Wei.
Relation to host. Vagrant on leaf surface. No damage to the host was observed.

Etymology. The specific designation
zhouzhis
is from the name of location of the mites were collected.
